alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 2:45AM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...Until this morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 20.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 AM EST Sunday was 24.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is receding and will continue to recede to near 19.5 feet around 7 AM EST and further recede to around 17.3 feet around 7 AM EST on Monday. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued 8 AM EST.
